description: Configuration for the comprehensive diabetes model

pages.title: New Scenario Setup

fieldsets.title: Diabetes type: choose one from the dropdown menu below
enumNames: Screening for type 2 diabetes and prediabetes

save_population.description: *Saved population available only after viewing results

enumNames: Save population dataset on completed simulation run
Save config file on completed simulation run

header_buttons.common_text: Save Population/Config on Completed Simulation Run

built_in_page.title: Population Dataset
built_in_page.message: A preloaded population dataset may be selected here. If none are selected, then you will be prompted to configure a new one later in the setup process.

Important Note:.description: You have chosen the Prediabetes (Screening) diabetes type. Please either use one of the predefined population datasets (with 'pre-screen' in the title), or if you are using a user-uploaded population dataset, ensure that it includes either an A1c or FPG column. These columns will be used to calculate diagnosis.

pages.title: Scenario Setup: Basic - Type 1 Diabetes

fieldsets.title: Type of simulation to run
fieldsets.description: Complication costs and disutilities are also included in PSA.

fieldsets.title: Number of iterations
fieldsets.description: In 'Standard', this is the number of times a simulation is run. In 'Sensitivity analysis', this is the number of times a new set of values is drawn.

fieldsets.title: Simulation Seed
fieldsets.description: seed value can be anything between 1 and 9999

fieldsets.title: Number of individuals in the population
Time horizon execution strategy
fieldsets.description: 'Fixed' runs for a set duration. 'Max age' runs until the youngest individual reaches the max age. 'All deceased' runs until all agents have passed away.
enumNames: All deceased (this will take a long time to run)

risk_reductions.description: Enter risk reductions as positive numbers written as fractions (e.g., for 20% reduction, enter 0.20). For increases, enter negative number.

pages.title: Scenario Setup: Intervention Sets - Prediabetes
Scenario Setup: Intervention Sets - Lifestyle intervention - Prediabetes

fieldsets.title: Lifestyle intervention
fieldsets.description: The lifestyle intervention is only applied to people with A1c in the prediabetes range (5.7-6.4%) and BMI>=25 and FPG in the prediabetes range (100-125 mg/dl). To change these criteria, use advanced intervention by selecting it from the dropdown menu above.

bmi_change_text.title: Percent change in BMI relative to baseline (Enter percentage changes as a fraction, e.g. enter –0.05 for a 5% reduction)

Apply to persons with HbA1 between.title: Apply to persons with HbA1c (%) between

Apply to persons with FPG between.title: Apply to persons with FPG (mg/dL) between

Percent change in BMI relative to baseli.title: Percent change in BMI relative to baseline (Enter percentage changes as a fraction, e.g. enter -0.05 for a 5% reduction.)

enumNames: Instead of using the BMI changes entered above, calculate the reduction in onset risk directly according to relative risk reductions entered below.

text_1.title: If percentage reduction in onset risk is calculated directly, the following values will be used (Enter percentage reductions as a positive fraction, e.g., enter 0.40 for a 40% reduction):

text_3.title: Change in other factors (enter negative numbers for reductions and positive numbers for increases)

header_buttons.common_text: Modify effects on annual probability of diabetes onset

pages.title: Scenario Setup: Intervention Sets - Screening

intervention_type_text.title: Select interventions to use:
intervention_type_text.description: * You have chosen the Screening diabetes type. Ensure that you have selected at least one Advanced Type 2 Diabetes Intervention from the list below (Glycemic, Cholesterol, Blood Pressure)

pages.title: Scenario Setup: Intervention Sets - Lifestyle intervention - Screening

fieldsets.title: Lifestyle intervention
fieldsets.description: The lifestyle intervention is only applied to people with A1c in the prediabetes range (5.7-6.4%) and BMI>=25 and FPG in the prediabetes range (100-125 mg/dl). To change these criteria, use advanced intervention by selecting it from the dropdown menu above.
